question:
Consider the following statements with respect to Sabrimala Temple that has been recently in news:
  1. It is situated in the Poongavanam forest of Parambikulam Tiger Reserve
  2. It follows the traditions of Shaivism only
  3. Women of any age group hasnâ€™t been traditionally allowed inside the temple
Which of the statements given above is/are correct?
explanation: Sabarimala Temple is a temple complex situated on a hilltop amidst eighteen hills at an altitude of 480 mabove sea level. Statement 1 is incorrect:-It is surrounded by mountains and dense forests of Poongavanam inside the Periyar Tiger Reserve in Pathanamthitta District, Kerala, India. Statement 2 is incorrect:- The temple is dedicated to the Hindu celibate deity Ayyappan also known as Dharma Sastha, who according to belief is the son of Shiva and feminine incarnation of Vishnu. The traditions of Sabarimala are a confluence of Shaivism, Shaktism, Vaishnavism, and other Sramanas traditions. Statement 3 is incorrect:- Being the celibate nature of deity, according to temple traditions only old women and young girls are allowed inside the temple and those who have attained the age of puberty and to a certain time of life are forbidden to approach as all sexual intercourse in that vicinity is believed to be averse to deity .
